channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Continuous problem with communal bins being left open., 2nd September
item.description:
Constantly left open, for more than 2 weeks now. Large flies and now LARGE MAGGOTS, very unhygienic. Reported issue before, cleaner still leaving bins open. Lots of rain going in too. Bins left messy with rubbish hanging all over them.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Springfield, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ilegal fly posting, 2nd September
item.description:
These 2 people attached a yellow sign to the lamppost outside no7 Lassa Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lassa Road, Well Hall, London

item.title: Dumped Lime Bikes, 2nd September
item.description:
There are about a hundred Lime bikes dumped outside Stockwell Tube and outside Sainsbury's on Binfield Road. No-one can park their owned bikes, they're blocking pavements and businesses.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 225, Clapham Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing litter bin, 2nd September
item.description:
Please can you collect the rubbish from the bin at the northwest corner of the Smalley Rd Estate, just behind 69 Garnham Close.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garnham Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Bin placed in front of private residential building and gardens-it has to be Removed from the site_bad service from Council, 2nd September
item.description:
Dear team, I have sent 2 complains over the last few days and spend my valuable time about this matter and explained politely why the placement of the litter bin on front of Claremont House is not appropriate. Instead not only the Council has done nothing to rectify the issue but more importantly I have received a weird reply "Following our investigation, no action can be taken because it is the responsibility of non-local authority or privately owned/operated organisation. Your case is closed." I'd like to kindly remind you that you are getting paid with our money and what we expect from your end is to listen, understand and take actions. Clearly we don't pay you to provide ambivalent replies and close our case so bluntly. This case not only will not close but we will escalate it further. 1) Can I ask to receive more information about the "non-local authority or privately owned/operated organisation" you memtioned in your reply? 2) The litter bin will have to be removed from our building site and never to be placed again either in front of the building or any of its sides of Claremont House for all the reasons I explained diligently. Am I clear? I'm waiting for your feedback and immediate actions otherwise I will escalate more complains about the so far terrible service we receive from your end. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Quebec Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags and other household rubbish, 2nd September
item.description:
Bags of rubbish and other household/domestic rubbish dumped on road and pavement outside of No.4 Edmeston Close. This is on land which the council is responsible for cleaning/clearing. If you want to know who did it then knock on the door of No. 4.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edmeston Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Eltham college Junior school run, 2nd September
item.description:
For 30 minutes this morning residents of Cedar Mount were unable to exit or enter the estate due to Mottingham Lane being blocked by inconsiderate parking. We have tried liasing with the school but they said WE should have people in hi viz to manage the traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A resident MS JOANNE REID called early today to report that the waste man dumped all her Waste Recyling materials near the corner of her property and that when she approached him, he just shun him retorting that he does not care. He wants this removed immediately considering that mice and foxes will turn the area into a feasting place, 2nd September
item.description:
A resident called to report the unethical attitude of the waste crew that came to empty her bin around 10:30 am. He says to her surprise, the waste man just drag the metal bin along and when the recycling materials in the bin spill all over the ground, he
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southmoor Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E bikes obstructing highway, 2nd September
item.description:
Large numbers of bikes are constantly parked perpendicular to the pavement by as it turns the corner on double yellow lines in such a way that they obstruct vehicles, obstruct sight of vehicles turning the corner. They obstruct pedestrians trying to cross. This has been a long term issue and previously reported.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Brighton Terrace, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken picture with smashed glass, 2nd September
item.description:
As previously reported under 8079612, this was closed due to contractor being unable to find the issue. It is still there, on the bend between Scott’s Lane and Shortlands Rd on Hayes Lane. Photos show clearly where this issue is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Shortlands, London
